channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Bicam OKs proposal to suspend telco tower permit requirement
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: The bicameral conference committee on the proposed Bayanihan to Recover as One Act approved the inclusion of a provision to temporarily suspend certain permits for the installation and operation of telecommunications towers to boost internet and mobile connectivity in the country.

item.title: DOH eyes vaccine institute at RITM
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health is looking at having the proposed Vaccine Institute at the Research Institute for Tropical Medicine in Alabang, Muntinlupa to boost local development of vaccines in the country.

item.title: Palace hopeful Veloso can attain justice
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Detained overseas Filipino worker Mary Jane Veloso will now have a better chance to attain justice after the Supreme Court allowed her to testify against her job recruiters through a deposition from her detention cell in Indonesia where she was convicted and is facing a death sentence for drug-related charges.

item.title: Machines, test kits for pooled testing arrive in Philippines
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The private sector testing initiative led by Presidential Adviser for Entrepreneurship Joey Concepcion is ready for the pilot implementation of the pooled polymerase chain reaction tests in Metro Manila.

item.title: DTI, DOLE issue new workplace guidelines
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The Department of Trade and Industry (DTI) and Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) yesterday issued guidelines for additional protocols in the workplace, which include designating an occupational safety and health (OSH) committee and officer and providing temporary isolation facilities for symptomatic employees.

item.title: ‘Whole-of-nation’ approach vs COVID-19 sought
item.description: Sen. Bong Go has emphasized the need for a unified, whole-of-nation approach to further enhance the country’s response to the ongoing COVID-19 crisis.

item.title: Face shields mandatory at Crame
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Police officers and visitors at the Philippine National Police headquarters in Camp Crame will have to wear face shields and not just face masks starting tomorrow.

item.title: Working Pinoys among top drivers of COVID-19 spike
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Working individuals may be driving the rise of COVID-19 infection in the country and even unintentionally bringing the virus to their homes, according to the Department of Health.

item.title: Private schools get nod to open before October 5
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Private elementary and high schools may start classes ahead of the Oct. 5 school opening schedule for public schools in the country, the Department of Education clarified yesterday.

item.title: Resource persons bare fraudulent PhilHealth schemes
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: Some doctors are allegedly involved in the reported corrupt practices at the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. along with some hospitals and banks that allegedly served as remittance centers for the anomalous transactions, the “Task Force PhilHealth” revealed yesterday.
